snippet: John Terry and Anton Ferdinand, two professional soccer players, laid out an exchange of paint-peeling profanities that led to a charge of racial abuse.
abstract: London Journal; John Terry and Anton Ferdinand, professional soccer players, recall for a London court their exchange of profanities that led to charges being filed against Terry; Terry, captain of the Premier League team Chelsea and captain of the England national team before his arrest, is charged with using a racial slur against Ferdinand, a defender for Queens Park Rangers, in a game in October 2011.
lead_paragraph: John Terry and Anton Ferdinand, two professional soccer players, laid out an exchange of paint-peeling profanities that led to a charge of racial abuse.

headline.seo: Trial of Soccer Star Terry Revolves Around Foul Language
headline.main: At Trial Over Racial Slur, a Redefining of ‘Acceptable Language’
headline.print_headline: At Trial Over Racial Slur, a Redefining of ‘Acceptable Language’
